description.narrative:
I slutet av oktober 2011 undertecknade Raoul Wallenberg Institutet (RWI) och Sida ett avtal för perioden 1 juli 2011 - 31 December 2015 för genomförandet av ett regionalt Afrika-program. Efter diskussion mellan ambassaden i Addis Abeba och RWI, har det beslutats att en ettårig förlängning av avtalet ska göras med syfte att möjliggöra för RWI att säkerställa resultat, uppnå ökad hållbarhet av uppnådda resultat, och genomföra framåtblickande verksamhet, med tanke på att den nämnda förlängningsperioden också kommer att anta funktionen av en exitfas. Förlängningen kommer att täcka en aktivitetsfas mellan 1 januari - 31 december 2016 och uppgår till 7 miljoner kronor, som delas in i två utbetalningar.
Det förslag som RWI ämnar genomföra under förlängningsfasen är en direkt uppföljning av det arbete som utförts under perioden 2011-2015. Förslaget gäller följande huvudsakliga prioriterade områden inom ramen för programmet:
1: Samarbete med strategiska afrikanska akademiska institutioner 2: Samarbete med afrikanska nationella institutioner för mänskliga rättigheter (NHRIs) och deras regionala samarbetsmekanismer 3: Samarbete med den östafrikanska domstolen och andra regionala rättsliga organ 4: Stärka de mänskliga rättigheterna för kvinnor och fredsbyggande i Östafrika
Dessutom omfattar programmet ett femte prioriterat område, strategiska insatser, inom vilket medel kan användas för aktiviteter som inte tidigare planerats, men vars ändamål är i linje med det allmänna syftet och målen för samarbetet mellan Sida och RWI, i enlighet med artikel 2 av RWI:s generella avtal med Sida.
BEDÖMNING!

In late October 2011, the Raoul Wallenberg Institute of Human Rights and Humanitarian Law (RWI) and the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida) signed a sub-agreement for the period 1 July 2011 – 31 December 2015 on a cooperation programme entitled “Regional Africa Programme” (the Programme). After discussion between the embassy in Addis Abeba and RWI, it has been decided that a one-year extension of the agreement will be made to allow for RWI to assure enhanced results achievements, increased sustainability of results achieved, and forward-loooking activities, considering that the extension period will also assume the function of an exit phase. The extension will cover an activity phase of 1 January-31 December 2016 and amount to 7 million SEK, divided into two disbursements.
The proposal submitted by RWI is a direct follow-up of the work performed during the period 2011-2015. The work plans concern the following main priority areas under the programme:
Priority Area 1: Cooperation with Strategic African Academic Institutions Priority Area 2: Cooperation with African National Human Rights Institutions (NHRIs) and their regional cooperation mechanisms Priority Area 3: Cooperation with the East African Court of Justice and other regional judicial bodies Priority Area 4: Strengthening Human Rights of Women and Peace Building in East Africa
In addition, the programme comprises a fifth priority area, Strategic Interventions, for which designated funds can be used for purposes arising during the course of the implementation of the programme, which were not previously planned for and which are in line with the general purpose and objectives of the cooperation between Sida and RWI, as provided for in Article 2 of the General Agreement.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Though the achievement varied between the different programme components, it has made a clear and notable progress towards the achievement of key results. In the area of cooperation with strategic African academic institutions that aimed at, inter alia, supporting the development of regional academic centers and institutions of excellence for building capacities in promoting human rights, peace and security, good governance; the program has contributed towards the provision of high quality human rights education and research in the region. The Program’s institutional development work during the entire programme period has been critical to enhancing the technical capacity, sustainability and outreach of National Human Rights Institutions (NHRIs) and their umbrella organization, the Network of African National Human Rights Institutions (NANHRI). The program has also made achievements in its support to the East African Court of Justice (EACJ) through activities intended at developing the skills of the Court’s Judges and improving the visibility of the Court vis-à-vis citizens. With a view of strengthening the human rights of women and peace building in East Africa, the program has successfully undertaken targeted interventions critical to improving the capacity of African youth and women’s organizations in the areas of knowledge and information management, budgeting and resource allocation for the implementation of UNSCR 1325 as well as in coordination and partnership development.
According to an independent evaluation of the program (June 2016), the four strategic interventions of the program have been effectively implemented by RWI and that they are likely to have added some value to the various stakeholders involved including the East African Court of Justice (EACJ), Network of African National Human Rights Institutions (NANHRI) and Strategic Pan-African Academic Institutions.
